description:
But first to the United States where President Obama has written to Congress, saying he's removing Cuba's name from the list of state sponsors of terrorism. It follows face-to-face talks at the weekend between Barack Obama and Raúl Castro, the first for more than half a century between the serving leaders of Cuba and the USA. So, how normal are relations between the two countries now? I asked our North America editor Jon Sopel.

"I think it's a big step. I think that this is a sign that the relationship between Cuba and the United States is being put on a very different footing. It also has more than just a symbolic importance, it has a real importance because this now paves the way for the two countries to be able to reopen their embassies in their respective capitals. And I was in Havana last week and saw that the flagpole of the, outside the US embassy had just had a fresh lick of paint. Well, now a stars and stripes will be able to hang from it because diplomats will be able to go to Havana, and likewise Cuban diplomats will be able to come to Washington. One other thing worth saying about this vow is that it means that the Cubans can now open US bank accounts."
